name: Witch Hazel
description: A premier astringent that tightens distended veins and stops minor bleeding.
usage: Topical extract or distilled water. Used as a compress to shrink inflamed tissues.
_comment: Source: The Complete Collection of Barbara O'Neill

name: Wood Betony
description: A grounding herb that 'draws the energy out of the head' and back into the body.
usage: Infusion. One of the best herbs for people who feel 'stuck in their head' or over-analytical.
_comment: Source: The Complete Collection of Barbara O'Neill

name: Wormwood
description: An extremely bitter herb used primarily to expel intestinal parasites and stimulate the liver.
usage: Infusion (very short-term) or tincture. Its extreme bitterness sparks the entire digestive fire.
_comment: Source: The Complete Collection of Barbara O'Neill

name: Yarrow
description: The 'master of the blood'it can stop a hemorrhage or move stagnant blood, as needed.
usage: Hot tea to induce sweating for fevers; powder topically to stop bleeding; cold tea for kidneys.
_comment: Source: The Complete Collection of Barbara O'Neill

name: Yellow Dock
description: A blood tonic that improves iron absorption and stimulates bile flow from the liver.
usage: Decoction or syrup. It helps release iron stored in the tissues back into the bloodstream.
_comment: Source: The Complete Collection of Barbara O'Neill

name: Yohimbe
description: A powerful stimulant that increases blood flow to the extremities and pelvic region.
usage: Standardized extract. Caution: Can cause heart palpitations, anxiety, and high blood pressure.
_comment: Source: The Complete Collection of Barbara O'Neill

name: Yucca Root
description: Contains high levels of steroid-like saponins that reduce joint inflammation.
usage: Decoction or capsules. It acts as a natural 'detergent' for the joints, clearing debris.
_comment: Source: The Complete Collection of Barbara O'Neill

name: Nyamedua (Gods tree)
description: A plant used for treating stubborn hypertension.
usage: Cut either the stem bark or root bark and boil with water for 20 mins. Drink a teacupful twice daily.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Wiregrass (Paragis)
description: A potent plant for various ailments.
usage: Boil a handful of the leaves and drink a teacupful twice daily before meals.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Mango Leaves
description: Leaves from the mango tree used for diabetes management.
usage: Take 2 tablespoonful of dried powdered leaves into hot water and close it with a lid before going to bed. Drink this extract on an empty stomach first thing in the morning.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Mast Tree
description: A tree used for treating malaria and supporting immune function.
usage: Boil leaves and drink a teacupful twice daily. Can be mixed with key lime.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Pawpaw Leaves
description: Leaves from the pawpaw plant used for insomnia.
usage: Brew as tea and drink.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Scent Leaves
description: Leaves used for respiratory issues.
usage: Do steam inhalation with scent leaves or use as remedy for headache.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Avocado Seeds
description: Seeds used for high blood pressure reduction.
usage: Use as recommended to reduce blood pressure.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Moringa Seeds
description: Seeds for sexual health.
usage: Chew 2-3 seeds.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Touch-Me-Not Herb
description: Herb for ADHD and focus.
usage: Make a tea with two tablespoons of the dried herb.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Apple of Sodom
description: Latex for keloids.
usage: Apply latex of plant on affected part till keloid disappears.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Dandelion Leaves
description: Leaves for liver and other issues.
usage: Boil either fresh or dried leaves and drink a teacupful twice daily before meals.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Baobab Fruit
description: Fruit for various health benefits.
usage: Boil the dried fruits and drink 3 tablespoons thrice daily.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Crown of Thorns
description: Plant for multiple conditions.
usage: Boil the dried powdered leaves in water and drink 4 tablespoons three times daily. Apply latex on warts.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Indian Almond Plant
description: Plant for sickle cell support.
usage: Use as recommended.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Snake Plant
description: Rhizomes for ear issues.
usage: Grind rhizomes into paste and apply two drops into affected ear once daily.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Jehovah Witness Blood Tonic Plant
description: Plant that increases haemoglobin levels faster than synthetic haematinics.
usage: Get a handful of the leaves and boil with water for 15-20 mins. Drink a teacup twice daily.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Castor Plant
description: Leaves used for joint pains and arthritis.
usage: Grind the leaves into paste and rub on joints and any painful area. Boil the leaves and drink a teacupful twice daily.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Guava Leaves
description: Leaves for stomach ulcer, GERD, acid reflux and abdominal pains.
usage: Boil for 15-20 mins and drink a teacup twice daily. Chew five leaves for instant relief.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Worm Grass
description: Powerful herb for intestinal worm infestation.
usage: Use a tablespoon of the dried leaves as tea twice daily.
_comment: Source: @HerbalistChief X/Twitter

name: Jungle Flame
description: One of the best plants for treating all forms of tumour in the body.
usage: Use as recommended.

name: Ashwagandha
description: Amazing plant where every part is medicinal.
usage: Use the leaves or roots as tea.

name: Ringworm Plant (Asunwon oyinbo / Osempe)
description: Plant for constipation.
usage: Boil a handful of the leaves and drink a teacupful only once in a day.

name: Pencil Plant
description: Plant with medicinal uses.
usage: Use as recommended.

description: Leaves for various ailments.

description: Leaves for blood purification and skin health.

name: Bitter Leaf
description: Leaves for blood sugar and malaria.

name: Blackjack Plant
description: Plant for various infections and conditions.

name: Wild Dandelion
description: Leaves for infections and liver issues.

name: Cocks Comb Plant
description: Plant for rheumatism and infections.
usage: Uproot whole plant, cut into pieces and boil with water. Drink a teacup twice daily for a month.

name: Bitter Leaves
description: Leaves for malaria and diabetes.
usage: Boil either fresh/dried leaves in water for 20mins. Drink half a cup twice daily.

description: Plant with broad antimicrobial properties.
